name: Ethereum 101
description: Test your knowledge on the Ethereum blockchain protocol, the EVM and what differentiates it with other blockchains.

questions.title: What major improvement differentiated Ethereum from its predecessors (such as Bitcoin) during launch?
answers: It provided a Turing complete scripting language that allowed to execute code called smart contracts
It provided a more sustainable, energy-efficient consensus algorithm
It had less than 21M circulating supply of its base currency
It provides anonymity and private transactions

questions.title: Who's the inventor of the Ethereum protocol?
What is a Smart contract?
answers: A piece of self-executing code that runs on a blockchain
A protocol used for secure communication

questions.title: On Ethereum, what is considered the truth?
answers: The truth is what Vitalik Buterin says
The truth is what the Ethereum Foundation says
The truth is what the majority of the developer community says
The truth is the set of data that all participants eventually agree on

questions.title: What is the EVM?
answers: The master node that verifies all transactions
A piece of software that you need to run to manage your digital assets

questions.title: How are infinite loops handled in EVM code?
answers: The EVM does not allow for infinite loops
Every computational step costs gas and execution stops when a transaction is running out of gas
The EVM only allows for 512 computation steps per transaction
The EVM continues to process and its output fills up disk space

questions.title: How are transaction fees determined?
answers: Validators decide how much you have to pay for each transaction
The fees depend on the amount of computational steps required to execute the transaction
The fees are based on a small percentage from the value of the transaction
Whatever the sender of the transaction wants to pay for it

questions.title: What is the base transaction fee for sending a standard Ether transaction?
answers: It depends how much Ether you send

questions.title: If the gas price of a transaction is 40 gwei, this affects
What of the following information is not part of a block?
answers: The slot that the block belongs to
A hash of the preceding block so it can't be tampered with
All the transactions sent to the network since the last block
The transaction data that was included into the block

questions.title: How long does it take to finalize a block?
On Sept 15, 2022 Ethereum transitioned to proof-of-stake, officially deprecating proof-of-work, also called 'the merge'. Which of the following have been a direct consequence of the merge?
answers: Reduced supply of its base currency Ether
Reduced energy consumption than Proof of Work (up to 99,95%)

questions.title: What are the primary benefits of Proof of Stake compared to Proof of Work?
answers: It's more economically efficient resulting in higher security for a lower issuance
It provides options to recover from attacks inherit to the protocol itself
